description: for supporting arm/arm64 in addition to x86 instances within the same region/zone, flavor details should also list arch, so a user/program can select the flavor appropriately.
title: flavor details should include arch

comments.content: for supporting arm/arm64 in addition to x86 instances within the same region/zone, flavor details should also list arch, so a user/program can select the flavor appropriately.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hazmat

comments.content:
I believe your use case is already covered using the filter scheduler.  A good thread to read would be:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-August/000691.html

Is there something missing here that you need?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content:
Afaik the scheduler is pretty opaque to an api user. I'm looking for a
mechanism to discover what architecture a given openstack instance supports
using its api. While i agree with the comments in that thread that a
compatible flavor and image combination are required to make it work, i
disagree that this is soley the property of the image, as that leaves zero
ability to introspect the system capabilities as an api user. ie its
 possible to have an arm compatible image with no applicable hardware. The
flavor/instance-type level introspection seems the most appropriate to
allow for an api user to distinguish hardware.
